boardgame.name: Elhendi
boardgame.description:
From the back of the rulebook:

»Elhendi« fantasiaroolipeli

Koe uskomattomia urotekoja, sankarillisia taisteluita ja uhrautuvaa ystävyyttä.
Tutki mystisiä paikkoja; muinaisia rakennuksia, tarumaisia temppeleitä ja alkuaikaisia metsiä.
Näe mahtavia maageja, voimakasta taikuutta ja hämmästyttäviä loitsuja.
Kohtaa verenhimoisia petoja, säälimättömiä hirviöitä ja häilyviä henkimaailman asukkeja.
Löydä ikivanhoja salaisuuksia, odottamattomia ansoja sekä muita kammottavia yllätyksiä.
Kerää hahmollesi kokemusta, kunniaa ja mainetta ja kehitä sen kykyjä ja taitoja aina yhdeksännelle tasolle asti!

Elhendin edeltäjä, legendaarinen haltiaroolipeli 'Rapier' loppuunmyytiin Suomessa ennennäkemättömän nopeasti. 'Rapierin' hyväksi koetun systeemin lisäksi Elhendi tarjoaa monia sekä täysin uusia että vanhoja hyviä, mutta selvennettyjä sääntökohtia. Pelin hahmonluonti on todella vapaata ja helppoa, taistelusäännöt ovat nopeat mutta silti monipuoliset. Elhendissä kuka tahansa pelihahmo voi perehtyä magian salaisuuksiin ja opetella loitsuja, joiden määrää on lisätty. Haltioiden yhteiskunnan ja mantereen historian taustatietojen lisäksi löytyy kirjasta mielenkiintoisia yksityiskohtia uskonnosta, jumalista, -taikaesineistä, yrteistä, elämistä, hirviöistä ja muista otuksista. Mukana seuraavat irrotettavat haltiamaan ja koko mantereen kartat ovat upeaa tekoa, kuten myös kirjan runsas kuvitus.

Uutuutena Elhendissä on mukana helppokäyttöinen seikkailugeneraattori, jolla kiireinen pelinjohtaja pystyy hetkessä luomaan mielikuvituksellisia seikkailujuonia tavoitteineen ja vihollisineen.

Elhendin parissa voit eläytyä ennenkokemattomiin fantastisiin seikkailuihin yhdessä ystäviesi kanssa. Elhendiin tarvitaan vähintään kaksi pelaajaa, suositeltava määrä on kolmesta kahdeksaan. Pelissä tarvitaan tämän sääntökirjan lisäksi kyniä, paperia ja joukko erikoisnoppia.

Elhendin pelaaminen edistää mielikuvituksen käyttöä ja luovaa ideointia, opettaa vapaata pelinjohtamista ja empaattista yhteistoimintaa. Lisäksi Elhendi fantasiaroolipeli tarjoaa tietysti pelaajilleen harmitonta, hauskaa ja jännittävää viihdettä tunneiksi - kuukauksiksi - vuosiksi.

---

Translation:

»Elhendi« fantasy roleplaying game
See the unbelievable heroism on battlefields and experience devoting friendship.
Explore mystical locations; ancient constructions, fabled temples and primeval woodland.
Meet mighty mages, strong spells and incredible incantations.
See bloodlust beasts, merciless monsters and wavering wanderers of spirit worlds.
Discover age-old secrets, unforeseen traps and other dreadful surprises.
Collect experience, prestige and honor to your character and build-up its skills and levels all the way up to the ninth level!
Elhend's predecessor legendary elven roleplaying game 'Rapier' was sold out in Finland unforeseen swift. Besides 'Rapier's' well balanced game system, Elhendi is offering many completely new but also clarified old good rules. Character creation is really simple and open-ended, fighting rules are quick but versatile. In Elhendi all characters can familiarize themselves with a secret of magic and learn cast spells. In addition to information about elven society and continents background stories core rulebook contains interesting details from religions, gods, -magical items, herbs, animals, monsters and another beings. With a book comes detachable map of elven lands and entire game continent. Maps are awesomely sketched as also plentiful illustrations of the book.
As a novelty in Elhendi is included easy to use adventure generator, which allows game masters with no extra time in hands to create just in a moment imaginary adventure schemes with unique aims and enemies.
Amidst Elhendi you can empathize never before experienced fantastic adventures together with your friends. For playing Elhendi you need at least two players, but it is recommended to have three to eight players. To play a game you need additionally to this core rulebook a pen, paper and set special of dice.
Playing Elhendi will develop the use of imagination and creative thinking; learn unfettered game mastering and empathic co-operation. In addition Elhendi fantasy roleplaying game offers to its player’s harmless, pleasant and exciting entertainment for hours - months - years.

Blue Max (DOS)
boardgame.description:
Back of Box

1914--the peaceful blue skies over France are shattered forever by the machine guns of mankind's first fighting aircraft.

The medal "Pour le Mérite"--The British called it "the Blue Max"--was awarded to the best German pilots of World War I. To flyers of both sides it symbolized the utmost in daring, courage and honor during a time that will never be repeated in the story of aviation.

In Blue Max: Aces of the Great War, begin by choosing sides and one of eight great fighters. Action is immediate and relentless, as you fly the most famous aircraft of the time--Fokker, Spad, Nieuport, Sopwith, Albatross--with the best of the best, including Richthofen, Fonck, Mannock, and Rickenbacker. Learn the characteristics of each plane, and the different tricks and techniques of each ace.

Different playing modes let one or two players fly solo, as a team, or against each other using the same computer. Fly in full action dogfights, undertake missions to destroy bridges and observation balloons, or work out strategies a segment at a time in detail.

boardgame.name: The Road to Canterbury
boardgame.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Greed, Pride, Gluttony, Wrath, Luxury, Idleness, and Envy – the infamous "Seven Deadly Sins". For the faithful, they instill horror. For you, on the other hand, they present a wonderful business opportunity!

In The Road to Canterbury, you play a medieval pardoner who sells certificates delivering sinners from the eternal penalties brought on by these Seven Deadly Sins. You make your money by peddling these counterfeit pardons to Pilgrims traveling the road to Canterbury. Perhaps you can persuade the Knight that his pride must be forgiven? Surely the Friar's greed will net you a few coins? The Miller's wrath and the Monk's gluttony are on full public display and demand pardoning! The Wife of Bath regales herself in luxury, the Man-of-Law languishes in idleness, and that Prioress has envy written all over her broad forehead. And the naughty stories these Pilgrims tell each other are so full of iniquity they would make a barkeep blush! Pardoning such wickedness should be easy money, right?

Not quite. For you to succeed as a pardoner, you'll need to do more than just sell forged pardons for quick cash. To keep your services in demand, you will actually need to lead these Pilgrims into temptation yourself! Perhaps some phony relics might help? There is also one big catch. The Seven Deadly Sins live up to their name: each sin that a Pilgrim commits brings Death one step nearer, and a dead Pilgrim pays no pardoners!

So much to forgive, so little time. Will you be able to outwit your opponents by pardoning more of these Pilgrims' sins before they die or finish their pilgrimage to Canterbury?

boardgame.description:
From the publisher's introduction:

"Call of Duty" is a Call of Cthulhu scenario set in the fictional city of Durban, Rhode Island, in the year 1925. The investigators play agents from the Federal Bureau of Investigation trying to shut down Antonio Marchesi's illegal operations, which include nefarious acts such as bootlegging and the release of Gods from beyond space and time. So! Pull down your fedora, check your badge, load another drum in your Tommy Gun, and get ready to put your sanity to the test―your superiors will never believe this.

boardgame.name: Pinpoint the Bomber
boardgame.description:
This is a book game. Published as a book it includes multiple black & white and color maps. There are 3 games described, the Red, the Green and the Black game.

The Black game is a solo effort to see how long it takes and how accurate you can be with determining your map pinpoints.

The Red game is meant for 4 players or fewer. It is a game of chance and is won by the first person to reach the bombing target (the German city of Coblenz).

The Green game is for any number of players, again as a game of chance but requires finding Pinpoints via Latitude and Longitude.

In the Red and Green games a number of aircraft set off from their base in Kent to bomb a target at Coblenz.

The games requires the player to copy and create miniature airplanes, Compass Rose, 10 deg angle indicator and Latitude/Longitude Finder.

The game includes maps as well as extensive briefing triggered by either a draw from a deck of cards or dice roll. The players continue to roll/draw cards until they land on the target by exact count. Any overshooting requires the bomber to fly back around.

A briefing can have extensive instructions causing the player to head off track or be attacked by enemy fighters ending in a change of course and position on the map.

boardgame.name: Sky Castles
boardgame.description:
Sky Castles is a tile and worker placement game where the players collect gemstones from castles in the clouds. The theme is aimed at children, but the game claims to provide scope for strategic play at all levels.

The tiles depict a cloudscape dotted with gemstones. Each turn the player selects one of four face-up tiles and places it into the cloudscape so that the borders match adjacent tiles, and can optionally place a sprite token to claim a cloud or section of sky. There are three scoring rounds where the players score points for the gemstones that their sprites have claimed.

The gameplay is similar to other tile placement games (e.g. Carcassonne) but Sky Castles has less complexity and claims to be suitable for a younger audience while retaining similar strategic options.

boardgame.name: Chuck Yeager's Advanced Flight Simulator
Chuck Yeager's Advanced Flight Trainer
boardgame.description:
Chuck Yeager's Advanced Flight Trainer is a 1987 computer aircraft simulation game produced by Electronic Arts. Chuck Yeager served as technical consultant for the game, where his likeness and voice were prominently used.

The game allows a player to "test pilot" 14 different airplanes, including the Bell X-1, which Yeager had piloted to become the first man to exceed Mach 1. Other aircraft one can test fly include the SR-71 Blackbird; the P-51 Mustang; the Cessna 172 Skyhawk; the F-16 and the F/A-18.

The game is embellished by Yeager's laconic commentary: When the user crashes one plane, Yeager remarks "You really bought the farm on that one!"

Game reviewers Hartley and Patricia Lesser complimented the game in their "The Role of Computers" column in Dragon #126 (1987), stating "There is so much in this game that it’s going to be quite some time before another flight simulator can offer so much performance for your buck." The reviewers gave the PC/MS-DOS version of the game 4 out of 5 stars.

The game was followed in 1989 by Chuck Yeager's Advanced Flight Trainer 2.0 and in 1991 by Chuck Yeager's Air Combat.

Source: Wikipedia, "Chuck Yeager's Advanced Flight Trainer", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
